abstract: As China’s stock market plummeted, large money managers sold substantial amounts of their stock in the two Chinese technology giants, both of whose shares are down sharply.
snippet: As China’s stock market plummeted, large money managers sold substantial amounts of their stock in the two Chinese technology giants, both of whose shares are down sharply.
lead_paragraph: As China’s stock market took a free fall earlier this summer, big money managers looked to sell shares of two of the largest Chinese tech companies listed in the United States — Alibaba and Baidu — during the second quarter.

headline.main: Hedge Funds Shed Shares in Alibaba and Baidu in Second Quarter

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Alexandra Stevenson
